title: Owen Stephens
text:
Owen George Stephens (born 9 January 1947), also known by the <a href="nickname">nickname</a> of "Noddy", is a New Zealand former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He has the distinction of being one of only three players to have played international rugby union for both <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a> and <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>.
Early life and family.
Stephens was born in <a href="Paeroa">Paeroa</a> in 1947 and educated at <a href="Tauranga%20Boys%27%20College">Tauranga Boys' College</a>. He is the son of the rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s for <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> (<a href="List%20of%20St%20Helens%20R.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 429</a>), <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> and <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Bradford%20Bulls%20players">Heritage №</a>); <a href="Mortimer%20Stephens">Mortimer Stephens</a>.
Rugby career.
He left New Zealand in 1970 and switched codes from rugby union to rugby league, but he was reinstated back into rugby union while in Australia. However, he later changed codes again to play rugby league.
Rugby union.
A <a href="rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a>, Stephens played for <a href="Bay%20of%20Plenty%20Rugby%20Union">Bay of Plenty</a> and <a href="Wellington%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Wellington</a> at a provincial level in New Zealand, and for the Athletic Rugby Club in Wellington. In Australia he played at club level for <a href="St.%20George%20Rugby%20Union%20Club">St. George</a>, and represented <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Waratahs">New South Wales</a>.
He won a single cap for New Zealand, playing in the All Blacks' 19–12 victory over France at <a href="Eden%20Park">Eden Park</a>, <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a> on 10 August 1968, and won five caps for Australia, playing against Tonga and Wales in 1973 and New Zealand in 1974. Only three players have played rugby union at <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">test match</a> level for both New Zealand and Australia: namely <a href="Des%20Connor">Des Connor</a>, <a href="Ted%20Jessep">Ted Jessep</a> and Stephens.
Rugby league.
He played club level rugby league for <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a> (trial), <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Parramatta%20Eels%20players">Heritage № 339</a>) (two spells), and <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 815</a>), as a , i.e. number 2 or 5.
